articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets Nepali Party Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam Meets Nepali Party Delegation

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, met a delegation of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist) headed by Darmendra Raj Bastala, member of the Political Bureau of the Party Central Committee and chairman of its Western Regional Committee, and had a talk with it in a friendly atmosphere on Wednesday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Nepali Party Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Nepali Party Delegation

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting delegation of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
					
					 Head of its delegation Darmendra Raj Bastala, member of the Political Bureau of the Party Central Committee and chairman of its Western Regional Committee, conveyed the gift to Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Wednesday.

articles.title: National Exhibition of August 3 Consumer Goods Opens
articles.content:
National Exhibition of August 3 Consumer Goods Opens
						

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The national exhibition of August 3 consumer goods opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition Wednesday.
					
					On display there are more than 122,000 consumer goods of over 10,000 varieties including daily necessities, garments, grass crafts and local farm goods produced by factories, enterprises and housewives' work-teams, reusable goods production work-teams and home workers for welfare service across the country.
					
					Jo Yong Chol, minister of the Foodstuff and Daily Necessities Industry, said in his speech at the ceremony that General Secretary Kim Jong Il has energetically led the work to make sure that consumer goods were produced as a mass movement. Recently, too, he clearly indicated ways of bringing about a turn in this work, the speaker added.
					
					 Working people in different parts of the country have conducted a dynamic drive to produce diverse and quality goods including mass consumption goods, true to the intention of Kim Jong Il, achieving signal successes.
					
					 The participants went round the exhibition.
					
					The sundry goods for daily use, folklore articles, etc. produced by industrial establishments, direct sales shops and management offices of housewives' work-teams in Pyongyang by use of by-products clearly showcase the devoted efforts of producers. 
					
					 Drawing attention of visitors are attractive and handy goods produced by housewives' work-teams and reusable goods production teams in various regions including North and South Hamgyong, South Phyongan and Kangwon provinces and Nampho City.

articles.title: Plenary Meeting of GFTUK Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Plenary Meeting of GFTUK Held in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The 69th plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) was held here on Tuesday.
					
					 The meeting discussed the tasks for the organizations of the trade unions to wage the vigorous mass movement including the socialist emulation in order to encourage the economic construction in the run-up to the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the GFTUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.

articles.title: New Varieties of Flowers Bred
articles.content:
New Varieties of Flowers Bred 

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Researchers of the Pyongyang Floriculture Research Center recently succeeded in putting a cultivation method of tulip of various colors and beautiful shape on a scientific basis.
					
					 The researchers solved technical problems concerning conditions of growth in winter and bulb storage, making it possible to propagate the flower in the country.
					
					 They have also adapted several dozen species of flowers, including cosmos and cockscomb, to the climatic conditions of Korea. 
					
					 Meanwhile, they selected good varieties of ever-green roses and developed a cultivation technology and a propagation method.

articles.title: Scenic Mountains
articles.content:
Scenic Mountains

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Celebrated mountains in the DPRK are visited by many people to enjoy their summer views.
					
					 Breathtaking is the scenery of Mt. Kumgang in Kangwon Province, Mt. Myohyang bordering North and South Phyongan and Jagang provinces, and Mt. Chilbo in North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 Mt. Kumgang is characterized by saw-toothed peaks, white clouds hovering over stratified rocks and cliffs, thick foliage, twitter and loud echoes of waterfalls.
					
					 Mt. Myohyang is famous for many species of plants, beauty spots and waterfalls.
					
					 Mt. Chilbo is a spectacular sight in summer. The onshore mountain has big and small arch-shaped rocks washed by waves, fantastic cliffs with many legends and thick woods.
					
					 Mt. Jangsu in South Hwanghae Province boasts of deep valleys.
					
					 Mts. Kuwol, Soksung and Ryongak and the Ulrim Falls also draw many tourists for their peculiar views.
					
					 Tourist facilities have been updated in the mountains.

articles.title: Lively Response Evoked by Drama "We Will Recollect Today" among People
articles.content:
Lively Response Evoked by Drama "We Will Recollect Today" among People

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Performance of drama "We Will Recollect Today", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, is going on every day before full house, evoking lively response among audience.
					
					 The drama deals with the persevering efforts of people in a mountainous county to implement in a do or die spirit the Workers' Party of Korea's policy on building minor power stations during the Arduous March. It makes an artistic representation of the ideological and moral world of the genuine patriots who live for tomorrow not merely for today. The audiences were deeply moved to watch the drama. 
					
					 After enjoying the drama, officials in the fields of light industry and agriculture said they keenly realized what was the source of such Herculean strength that made the Koreans stand on their own feet during the Arduous March. They renewed their pledge to bring about a great turn in the production of consumer goods and agricultural production through a dynamic drive for improving the standard of people's living and thus become genuine persons who would recollect today with pride in the future. 
					
					 Officials in the fields of coal, power, metal industries and railway transport vowed to display their mental power just as the heroes of the drama did when building a power station by their own efforts despite manifold ordeals, convinced that adversity leads to prosperity, and achieve fresh successes in the drive for a great surge. 
					
					 Officials of party and power bodies and working people's organizations in Pyongyang said the portrayal of the heroine of the drama, who, optimistic about future, bravely overcame sorrow over the death of the dear one and differences with those who eyed foreign style tells the truth that the success in implementing the party's policies depends on the officials.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Actions for Settlement of Registration Fee Issue in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Actions for Settlement of Registration Fee Issue in S. Korea 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Widespread actions of youth and students and citizens of south Korea for the settlement of the registration fee issue are attributable to the unpopular education policy of the conservative authorities of south Korea. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The government promised to halve the university registration fee to help families bring down their burdens of education expenses. This was the present chief executive's commitment during his "presidential campaign," the article says, and goes on:
					
					 No sooner had he come to power than he threw away this commitment like a pair of old shoes, making registration fee jump and depriving youth and students of the opportunity of learning.
					
					 A lot of south Korean students are doing hard work to earn money to pay the registration fee, subject to all sorts of humiliation. Not a few university students are toiling and moiling and girl students are subject to sexual abuses. But, the money they earn through this back-breaking labor is reportedly too meager to pay the registration fee. Therefore, not only the poor families but also middle-class families have to spend the hard-earned money to pay the registration fee. Not a few students are expelled from schools for failing to pay the yearly sky-rocketing school expenses. 200-300 students commit suicides out of despair in a year. There are also not a few parents of students who commit suicides, driven to despair after failing to pay school expenses for their children. 
					
					 South Korean students are now turning out in the actions to put an end to the traitorous rule of the present ruling quarters bringing misfortunes and sufferings to them and build a new society where everybody enjoys worthwhile life, given an ample opportunity of learning.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Suppressing Media Activities for Reunification
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Suppressing Media Activities for Reunification
						

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The Media Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration on July 28 issued a statement denouncing the authorities' suppression.
					
					 The authorities are unreasonably suppressing magazine Minjok 21 which has conducted legitimate media activities, the statement said.
					
					 The Intelligence Service searched the houses and offices of the managing editor and his father and the chief editor of the magazine and is busy making an investigation into them on charges of the violation of the draconic "National Security Law", it noted.
					
					 To crack down on the media activities conducted with the legitimate approval by the preceding regime by labeling them "enemy-benefiting ones" cannot be construed otherwise than a base move of the conservative regime to nullify the June 15 joint declaration and violate the freedom of speech, it stated.
					
					 The anti-reunification moves of the authorities suppressing the reunification movement organizations and individuals on the strength of the NSL deserve the people's judgment, it stressed.
					
					 It demanded the authorities stop at once the suppression of Minjok 21, ensure the legitimate media activities and sternly punish those responsible for the case.

articles.title: Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Demanded in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Students and citizens of south Korea held the 36th candlelight rally for the settlement of registration fee issue in Seoul on July 29. 
					
					 At the rally speakers deplored that the notification on the registration fee for the new school term is again irking university students.
					
					 They continued: 66 percent of the university students are paying the registration fee out of the loaned school expenses and they are, therefore, subject to destitution even after graduation due to debts. This is the reality of south Korea today.
					
					 The "government" and the "Grand National Party" are talking about university structuring and aid. This is an act of disregarding the reality and distortion of the nature of the issue of settling the registration fee issue.
					
					 They vowed to carry on their candlelight actions till the registration fee issue is settled.

articles.title: GNP's Remarks against Jeju Islanders under Fire
articles.content:
GNP's Remarks against Jeju Islanders under Fire
						

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on July 27 hit out an assemblyman from the "Grand National Party" for his remarks critical of the inhabitants on Jeju Island who opposed the construction of a naval base on the island.
					
					 Kim Mu Song, assemblyman from the GNP, called for the police involvement, branding the inhabitants standing against the construction of the base as "pro-north forces", the commentary said.
					
					 In the past he said that blaming Japan for its "territorial claim to Tok Islets" may lead to the decrease of the Japanese tourists, openly defending Japan. This had lashed the people into a fury, the commentary noted. He is now unhesitatingly talking about the theory of coloring.
					
					 Intolerable is the suppression of the people in their just actions by labeling them "pro-north forces", it said, demanding the assemblyman apologize to the islanders and resign.

articles.title: Lay-off Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Lay-off Protested in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- More than 15,000 people from all walks of life in south Korea staged an action in Pusan City on July 31 denouncing the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd for its lay-off measure.
					
					 At a meeting held earlier the speakers said that the people across south Korea, angered by the company side's harsh lay-off, gathered together determined to put an end to the present "government" which protects only capitalists.
					
					 The developments are not only confined to the company itself, they noted, calling on all the south Koreans to get united in solidarity to have the lay-off measure retracted.
					
					 They urged the authorities to help the fired workers get their jobs back and detain the owner responsible for the lay-off.
					
					 The participants held a press conference outside the company building.
					
					 They said the lay-off is a serious issue revealing the fundamental contradiction of the south Korean society.
					
					 The toiling and moiling workers should no longer have their vital rights threatened, they stressed.
					
					 They said they would escalate actions till the day when the workers have their jobs back, free from worries about lay-offs and part-time jobs.
					
					 The riot police were sent to the different parts of the city that day to check the people.
					
					 The enraged participants thronged to the Pusan District Police Office building to protest against the violent police which protect the owners and block the people's actions for vital rights.

articles.title: Korean People's Victory in War Observed by Nepali Papers
articles.content:
Korean People's Victory in War Observed by Nepali Papers
						

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Nepali papers carried special write-ups to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The Nepali paper Arpan on July 29 edited an article illustrated with a portrait of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It said the victory of the army and people of the DPRK in the war would be unthinkable without the wise leadership of the President.
					
					 He set forth original war methods, leading the Korean People's army to win victory after victory in every battle, and thus brought about a final victory of the war, it noted.
					
					 Another Nepali paper on July 28 carried a special write-up accompanied with a photo of the President.
					
					 It cited facts and numerical data to prove that the U.S. imperialists provoked a war of aggression to stifle the young DPRK by mobilizing huge forces but suffered a shameful defeat.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported by Nepali Organizations
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported by Nepali Organizations

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Nepali organizations made public a joint statement on July 29 on the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle. They included the Nepali Committee for Supporting the Reunification of Korea, the Nepali Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea, the Nepali Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, the Peace Action Committee of Nepal, the National Press Club of Nepal, the Nepali Association for Supporting the Songun Politics and the Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal.
					
					 The Korean Armistice Agreement was signed 58 years ago but the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are still keeping the U.S. forces and nuclear weapons in south Korea despite the sincere efforts of the DPRK to ensure peace, the statement said.
					
					 They are also becoming all the more pronounced in their moves to commit military provocations against the DPRK and threatening peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, it noted.
					
					 Korea should be reunified by the federal formula, it said, urging all countries concerned to positively help the Korean people reunify the country by their own efforts peacefully.

articles.title: Three Charters for National Reunification Hailed by Thai Organization
articles.content:
Three Charters for National Reunification Hailed by Thai Organization 

					Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand on July 28 issued a statement on the 14th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					
					 In the work he formulated the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by President Kim Il Sung as the three charters for national reunification. He also held that the cause of national reunification should be accomplished without fail on this basis in the future, the statement said.
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, an embodiment of the three charters for national reunification, and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, the statement noted, adding: The June 15 joint declaration is a great programme for Korea's reunification as it indicates the basic principles for achieving the national reconciliation, unity and reunification and ways to do so.
					
					 The three charters for national reunification, indeed, serve as an ever-lasting banner for putting an end to the division of Korea and reunifying the country, it stated.
					
					 It extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to realize the desire of the nation for reunification under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Anniversary of CPLA Marked in China
articles.content:
Anniversary of CPLA Marked in China
						

					 Beijing, August 2 (KCNA) -- China marked the 84th founding anniversary of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
					
					 The Ministry of National Defence held a party at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on July 31.
					
					 Liang Guanglie, minister of National Defence and state councilor, said in a speech that the CPLA has performed extraordinary feats not only in winning the independence and liberation of the nation but also in defending the sovereignty, security and territorial integrity and made a great contribution to promoting the economic and social development under the guidance of the Communist Party of China since its foundation. 
					
					 All the officers and men should be armed with the theoretical system of socialism with Chinese characteristics and adhere to the fundamental principle governing the work to ensure the absolute leadership of the party over the army and the main purport of the army without any vacillation, he stressed.
					
					 All the army and the people's armed police forces should perform the duties entrusted to them by the party and people, rallied close around the party central committee with Hu Jintao as general-secretary, he concluded.  
					
					 Meanwhile, various events took place at every unit of the CPLA such as friendship meeting of army and people, art performance, sports game, etc.

articles.title: China Announces Regulations on Commendation for Martyrs
articles.content:
China Announces Regulations on Commendation for Martyrs

					 Beijing, August 2 (KCNA) -- The State Council of China recently made public regulations on official commendation for martyrs.
					
					 The regulations, consisting of 6 chapters and 41 articles, call for following the spirit displayed by the martyrs and improving the living conditions of the bereaved families.
					
					 They take effect on August 1, 2011.

articles.title: China Gives Importance to Cultural Development
articles.content:
China Gives Importance to Cultural Development
						

					 Beijing, August 2 (KCNA) -- Liu Yunshan, head of the Publicity Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, called for working hard to make a signal progress in culture. 
					
					 During his recent inspection tour of Guizhou Province, he said that culture plays an important role in changing the mode of development, enhancing its level, improving the people's standard of living and promoting the harmony of society. 
					
					 He underlined the need to base the cultural development on the Chinese characteristics and the country's actual conditions.

articles.title: China Marks 1911 Revolution Anniversary
articles.content:
China Marks 1911 Revolution Anniversary
						

					 Beijing, August 2 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of calligraphic and art works took place at the Chinese Art Gallery in Beijing from July 25 to August 1 to mark the centenary of the 1911 Revolution.
					
					 The exhibition drew 450 calligraphic and art pieces.

articles.title: China Turns Out Well-qualified Persons
articles.content:
China Turns Out Well-qualified Persons 
						

					 Beijing, August 2 (KCNA) -- Recently, China announced a 2010-2020 plan to turn out able persons with high skill. 
					
					 The mid and long-term plan, the first of its kind in the country, gives main tasks for training able persons. 
					
					 According to data available, well-qualified persons numbered 26,310,000 in the country as of late 2009, an increase of 7,710,000 than late 2004.

articles.title: Russia Prepares for World Cup
articles.content:
Russia Prepares for World Cup 

					 Moscow, August 2 (KCNA) -- Russia is working on preparations for the 2018 World Cup.
					
					 Some time ago, the country announced a plan to lay a high-speed railway line between Nizhuny Novgorod and Kazan.
					
					 The plan is part of the railway construction program for the World Cup.
					
					 The country already launched a project for increasing the speed of Nizhuny Novgorod-Moscow railway service, which started last year, from 160kph to 200kph.

articles.title: Personnel Policy Committee for Judicial Organs Formed in Russia
articles.content:
Personnel Policy Committee for Judicial Organs Formed in Russia 

					 Moscow, August 2 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev signed a decree on organizing a permanent personnel policy committee for judicial organs on July 29.
					
					 The committee's mission is to ensure the president's authority over the personnel management of judicial organs. 
					
					 The advisory body is placed under the president's direct control.

articles.title: Wealth Gap Rises to Record High between US Whites, Minorities
articles.content:
Wealth Gap Rises to Record High between US Whites, Minorities

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The wealth gaps between whites and minorities in the United States have risen to record highs, reflecting the lopsided racial and ethnic impact of the recent economic recession, according to a Pew Research Center analysis released on July 26.
					
					 The median wealth of white households is 20 times that of African-Americans and 18 times that of Hispanics, the research said.

articles.title: Americans Complain about Authorities' Economic Policy
articles.content:
Americans Complain about Authorities' Economic Policy

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Americans are becoming increasingly discontented with the authorities' economic policy. 
					
					 According to the results of a recent national opinion poll jointly conducted by the Washington Post and the ABC, 57 percent of the respondents expressed strong discontent with the economic policy of the present administration.

articles.title: Japan's Enterprises Suffer Serious Losses
articles.content:
Japan's Enterprises Suffer Serious Losses

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Japanese enterprises are suffering losses due to the ceaseless economic depression.
					
					 NEC Corp. said Thursday it racked up a group net loss of 29.70 billion yen in the first three months of fiscal 2011.
					
					 Nintendo Co. said Thursday it booked a group net loss of 25.52 billion yen in the April-June quarter.
					
					 Japan's top cosmetics maker Shiseido Co. said Friday it incurred a 277 million yen group net loss in the first three months of fiscal 2011.

articles.title: Japan's Auto Output Plunges
articles.content:
Japan's Auto Output Plunges

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The auto industrial field of Japan is now in the grip of serious depression due to the economic crisis.
					
					 The Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association (JAMA) said in a report on Friday production dropped 29.2 percent in the January-June period of 2011 from a year earlier.

articles.title: Iranian President Condemns Big Powers for Their Hegemonic Moves
articles.content:
Iranian President Condemns Big Powers for Their Hegemonic Moves

					 Tehran, August 2 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, speaking at an event on July 30, strongly denounced the big powers for their hegemonic moves.
					
					 The global arrogance seeks to spread to the region through expansion of economic domination and protection of the Zionist regime, he said.
					
					 The legitimate rights of nations and their human values are being humiliated under the signboard of democracy in the western countries, he said.
					
					 He called upon mass media around the world to launch a comprehensive campaign against the global arrogance and the Zionist regime.

articles.title: Iran's High Cleric Blasts Enemy's Base Moves
articles.content:
Iran's High Cleric Blasts Enemy's Base Moves
						

					 Tehran, August 2 (KCNA) -- A high cleric of Iran on July 29 scathingly condemned the hegemonic forces and Israel for their base moves to deter the country from developing.
					
					 Recently the enemy is hatching all sorts of plots such as assassination of scientists in a bid to destabilize Iran and block the development of science and technology, he said.
					
					 But these moves would bring them nothing but disgrace and shame, he noted.
					
					 He called upon the young people of Iran to make redoubled efforts to attain a high peak of science no matter how desperate the enemy may become in its moves.

articles.title: President of Azerbaijan Calls for Regional Cooperation
articles.content:
President of Azerbaijan Calls for Regional Cooperation

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Ilham Aliyev, president of Azerbaijan, called for strengthening regional cooperation at a recent press conference. 
					
					He said nations bordering Caspian Sea, Black Sea and Baltic Sea should invigorate cooperation.     
					
					 He announced the results of summit talks between Azerbaijan and Poland and said the bilateral relations are of weighty importance in developing regional cooperation.

articles.title: Seminar on Integrated Economy Held in Vietnam
articles.content:
Seminar on Integrated Economy Held in Vietnam

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A seminar on integrated international economy was held in Vietnam recently.  
					
					 The seminar was attended by high-ranking officials from Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos and Myanmar.  
					
					 They agreed to strengthen sub-regional, regional and international cooperation to integrate the international economy.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- India and Bangladesh on Saturday inked a key agreement aimed at enhancing quality of border management and ensuring cross-frontier security through measures like joint vigils to deal with human trafficking and smuggling of drugs and weapons. 
					
					 On July 29 Iran and Tajikistan agreed to boost the bilateral cooperative relations in the fields of politics, economy and culture.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers keen on the "anti-terrorist war" in Afghanistan met deaths due to the attack of resistance forces.
					
					 Two soldiers with the NATO-led International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) were killed in eastern Afghanistan on Friday.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Wind gusts have torn roofing from houses, uprooted trees, and brought down power-lines as storms hit the southwest region of Western Australia (WA) on July 27.
					
					 Three people were killed in storms that have swept southern Brazil's Rio Grande do Sul State as of July 28, with more than 123,000 people being affected.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegación nepalesa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegación nepalesa 
						

					Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibió presente que le dedicara la delegación del Partido Comunista Unido de Nepal (Maoist) presidida por Darmendra Raj Bastala, miembro del Buró Político del Comité Central y presidente del comité de este partido en la región occidental, de visita en Corea. 
					
					El jefe de la delegación lo entregó el día 3 al miembro del Buró Político y secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam.

articles.title: Continúa función del drama "Recordaremos el día de hoy"
articles.content:
Continúa función del drama "Recordaremos el día de hoy"
						

					Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- Se ofrece diariamente la función del drama "Recordaremos el día de hoy", condecorado con el Premio Kim Il Sung, ganando grandes repercusiones de los espectadores. 
					
					  A través de los aspectos de los habitantes de un distrito montañoso, quienes en el período de la marcha penosa, materializaron a costa de la vida la orientación del Partido del Trabajo de Corea de construir las centrales hidroeléctricas de tamaño mediano y pequeño, la función muestra el mundo ideo-espiritual y el temperamento de lucha tenaz de los patriotas auténticos que viven no para hoy, sino para mañana.
					
					  Al ver la función, los funcionarios de sectores de la industria ligera y de la agricultura sienten profundamente con qué fuerza el pueblo coreano pudo levantarse en el período de la marcha penosa, y expresaron la voluntad de registrar un cambio en la producción de artículos de consumo popular y la producción agrícola avivando las llamas de gran auge para la mejora de la vida del pueblo y de  recordar con orgullo en el futuro lejano el día de hoy. 
					
					Los funcionarios de las ramas de industrias carbonífera, eléctrica y metalúrgica y del transporte ferroviario tomaron la decisión de poner de pleno manifiesto la inagotable fuerza espiritual y lograr nuevo triunfo en el gran auge de hoy, como lo hicieron los protagonistas del drama quienes construyeron por su propia cuenta una central hidroeléctrica superando múltiples pruebas con la firme convicción de que no hay miel sin hiel. 
					
					Los funcionarios de los organismos del partido y el poder y de las entidades de masas en esta capital dijeron que la imagen de la protagonista, quien con el optimismo en el futuro soporta la tristeza dolorosa y supera el antagonismo con quienes prefieren al estilo de ajenos, muestra que la realización de la política del Partido se decide por los funcionarios.

articles.title: Funcionaria meteorológica se entrevista con ACNC
articles.content:
Funcionaria meteorológica se entrevista con ACNC
						

					Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- Se prevé que las precipitaciones de los días 3 y 4 serán principalmente de 50-100 mm en las zonas costeras occidentales y las provincias de Jagang, Hamgyong del Sur y Kangwon y alcanzarán hasta 150 mm en algunas zonas. 
					
					Al respecto, una reportera de la ACNC se entrevistó con la subdirectora del Instituto Central Meteorológico, Sim Myong Ok (de 52 años).
					
					R: Quiero que usted me explique la causa de las últimas lluvias torrenciales.
					
					Sim: En nuestro país, julio y agosto son la temporada de lluvias. En ese tiempo, el país se ve influenciado por la alta presión atmosférica del Pacífico noroeste, causa del frente de lluvias. 
					
					Por esta razón, en todas las regiones del país caen muchas lluvias y a menudo sufren daños imprevisibles de aguacero y ciclón. 
					
					R: Entre los 26 y 28 de julio pasado, cayeron lluvias torrenciales en las provincias de Hwanghae del Sur y del Norte, la ciudad de Kaesong y otras zonas. ¿Podría aclararme ese fenómeno?
					
					Sim: Eso se debió a la inmovilidad del frente de lluvias que fue formado al borde noroeste de la alta presión del Océano Pacífico. 
					
					En comparación con otras estaciones, en el verano resulta muy lento el traslado de aire húmedo desde el oeste al este. 
					
					Ese fenómeno se observa con frecuencia también en nuestro país con topografía montañosa. 
					
					R: ¿Hasta cuándo persistirá la lluvia?
					
					Sim: Se prevé que los días 3 y 4, se registrarán muchas precipitaciones en la mayoría de la extensión territorial del país. En particular, los días 8 y 9, el tifón se observará en nuestro país y sus contornos.

articles.title: En Corea se aumentan plantas decorativas
articles.content:
En Corea se aumentan plantas decorativas 
						

					Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los investigadores del Centro de Investigación de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang adaptan las plantas decorativas de fama mundial en las condiciones climáticas de Corea.
					
					Últimamente, ellos establecieron de modo científico el método de cultivo de tulipán, flor atractiva de diferentes colores y de formas peculiares. 
					
					Resolvieron los problemas técnicos como el aseguramiento de condiciones de crecimiento en el invierno y su almacenamiento. 
					
					Además, cultivaron nuevamente las plantas decorativas de decenas de especies como cosmos y gallocresta, de acuerdo con las condiciones climáticas del país. 
					
					Por otra parte, seleccionaron de entre más de 100 variedades de rosas las más sobresalientes, que tienen largo tiempo de florecimiento y crecen durante todas las estaciones, y resolvieron la técnica de cultivo y el método de su reproducción.
